item.title: 野村的交易客户在市场操纵调查后回归
item.description: 据知情人士透露，野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Some clients of Nomura Holdings Inc. are restarting business with the Japanese brokerage after it took steps to address concerns arising from a regulatory probe into market manipulation, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 里昂证券和花旗对印度股市前景看法不一
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 澳大利亚反对党阻止留学生人数上限
item.description: 在反对党政治家决定投票反对拟议的法律之后，澳大利亚的国际学生人数上限计划似乎将受阻，尽管他们曾多次敦促削减移民人数。【原文：Australia’s plan to cap international student numbers looks set to be blocked after opposition politicians decided to vote against the proposed laws, even after they had repeatedly urged cuts to migration.】

item.title: 必和必拓警告澳大利亚矿业尚未准备好迎接低成本竞争者
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）澳大利亚负责人表示，澳大利亚无法依赖其传统的矿业出口市场，也没有准备好迎接低成本竞争者的新时代。【原文：BHP Group’s Australia chief said the nation can’t rely on its traditional mining export markets and is unprepared for a new era of lower-cost competitors.】

item.title: 泰国经济因出口和刺激政策增长 3%，超出预期
item.description: 泰国经济在第三季度的增长速度超过预期，这主要得益于出口的改善和政府支出的增加，政府正计划进一步刺激经济以保持增长势头。【原文：Thailand’s economy expanded faster than expected in the third quarter, driven by improving exports and and spending by the government, which is planning further stimulus to sustain the growth momentum.】

item.title: 高盛称 "买入黄金"，因央行买入，美联储将于 25 年减息
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）将黄金列为 2025 年最热门的大宗商品交易之一，并称在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任总统期间，黄金价格可能会延续涨势。【原文：Gold will rally to a record next year on central-bank buying and US interest rate cuts, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc., which listed the metal among top commodity trades for 2025 and said prices could extend gains during Donald Trump’s presidency.】

item.title: 阿达尼的绿色能源业务寻求重振美元债券交易
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的企业集团在上个月最后一刻推迟了绿色能源业务的美元债券发行，目前正寻求重启该业务的美元债券交易。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani’s conglomerate is looking to revive a dollar bond deal from its green energy business, after postponing such an offering last month at the last moment.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利和高盛因中国经济增长放缓而下调对中国股市的看法
item.description: 由于持续的通货紧缩压力和地缘政治紧张局势给全球第二大股票市场的盈利前景蒙上阴影，华尔街券商对中国股市的态度变得更加谨慎。【原文：Wall Street brokerages have turned more cautious on Chinese stocks as persistent deflationary pressures and geopolitical tensions cloud the outlook for earnings in the world’s second-largest equity market.】

item.title: WH 集团将在美国上市时发售最多 20% 的史密斯菲尔德股票
item.description: 全球最大的猪肉生产商 WH 集团有限公司在香港证券交易所提交的一份文件中称，该公司计划将其子公司史密斯菲尔德食品公司（Smithfield Foods Inc.【原文：The world’s biggest pork producer WH Group Ltd. plans to list up to 20% of shares of its subsidiary Smithfield Foods Inc. on the New York Stock Exchange or NASDAQ, it said in a Hong Kong stock exchange filing.】

item.title: 首尔公寓价格九个月来首次下降
item.description: 首尔的公寓价格九个月来首次下滑，最新数据支持了韩国央行上个月的政策转向，并预示着明年货币宽松政策有可能加速。【原文：Apartment prices in Seoul slipped for the first time in nine months, in the latest data supporting the Bank of Korea’s policy pivot last month and foreshadowing the potential for an acceleration of monetary easing next year.】

item.title: 上田对暗示日本央行加息时机持谨慎态度日元走软
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫在备受关注的评论中避免明确暗示将在 12 月的会议上加息，这使得日元走软。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda avoided giving a clear hint that he will raise interest rates at a December meeting during closely watched comments that weakened the yen.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将发行票据用于偿还债务和回购股票
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）已聘请银行出售美元和人民币债券，这些债券将用于偿还海外债务和回购股票，此前这家中国科技企业集团于今年早些时候发行了创纪录的可转换债券。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. has hired banks to sell dollar and yuan bonds that will be used to pay back offshore debt and buy back shares, following the Chinese tech conglomerate’s issuance of a record convertible bond earlier this year.】

item.title: 黄金周线深跌后反弹，利率前景扑朔迷离
item.description: 黄金在遭遇2021年以来最严重的单周跌幅后走高，原因是美元走强，以及交易商权衡了唐纳德-特朗普明年重返白宫后美联储降息的前景。【原文：Gold advanced after suffering its worst weekly drop since 2021, as the US dollar given and traders weighed the outlook for Federal Reserve rate cuts given Donald Trump’s return to the White House next year.】

item.title: 比特币跌至 90,000 美元附近，创美国大选以来最大跌幅
item.description: 比特币上周末创下了自美国大选以来最大的两日跌幅，原因是交易商在评估当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的政策议程可能产生的影响时，对全球市场持谨慎态度。【原文：Bitcoin posted its biggest two-day retreat over the weekend since the US election amid a bout of caution in global markets as traders assess the potential impact of President-elect Donald Trump’s policy agenda.】

item.title: 三星跳涨，70 亿美元回购意外受到市场欢迎
item.description: 韩国最大的公司三星电子公司周五晚些时候宣布了一项令人吃惊的计划，将在未来一年内回购约 10 万亿韩元（72 亿美元）的自有股票。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. shares surged Monday after South Korea’s biggest company announced a surprise plan late Friday to buy back about 10 trillion won ($7.2 billion) of its own stock over the next year.】

item.title: 英国房屋销售商在预算令人失望后提供大幅折扣
item.description: Rightmove 的数据显示，由于预算案令潜在购房者失望，且经济承受能力依然紧张，11 月份英国房屋要价的降幅超过往常。【原文：Asking prices for UK houses fell more than usual in November after the budget disappointed prospective buyers and affordability remained stretched, according to Rightmove.】

item.title: 受特朗普关税影响，高盛下调澳大利亚经济展望
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）下调了对澳大利亚2025年经济增长的预测，指出即将上任的特朗普政府预计对中国增加关税可能带来 "负面溢出效应"。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. lowered its forecast for Australia’s economic growth in 2025, pointing to likely “negative spillovers” from the incoming Trump administration’s expected increase in tariffs on China.】

item.title: 因担忧供应过剩和中国需求前景，原油维持周度跌势
item.description: 由于担心供应充足以及全球最大的原油进口国中国的需求前景，石油保持了周跌幅。【原文：Oil held a weekly decline on concerns over plentiful supply and the outlook for demand in China, the world’s biggest crude importer.】

item.title: 日元多头静待明年美日收益率差距缩小
item.description: 在连续两年看到日元反弹的赌注变成进一步下跌的冷酷现实后，一些策略师认为，第三次将是日本陷入困境的货币的魅力所在。【原文：After two straight years seeing bets on a yen rebound turn into the cold reality of further declines, some strategists reckon third time will be the charm for Japan’s beleaguered currency.】

item.title: 中国钢铁出口蓬勃发展，但这不会长久
item.description: 中国的钢铁出口大幅增长。历史表明，这种情况不会持久。【原文：China’s steel exports have exploded higher. History suggests it can’t last.】

item.title: 关税风险加剧紧张情绪，韩元可能面临更大压力
item.description: 韩元是今年亚洲表现第二差的货币，随着唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁给这个依赖出口的国家的经济前景蒙上阴影，韩元似乎有望进一步走软。【原文：The South Korean won, the second-worst performing currency in Asia this year, looks poised to weaken further as Donald Trump’s tariff threat clouds the export-reliant country’s economic outlook.】

item.title: 港股通开通 10 周年之际，投资者关注首次公开募股（IPO）渠道
item.description: 在中国通过与香港的贸易联系向广大国际投资者开放其交易所十年之后，投资者正渴望获得更深入的准入。【原文：A decade after China opened up its exchanges to a broad swath of international investors through a trading link with Hong Kong, investors are craving deeper access.】

item.title: 纽约市修订后的拥堵提案将在 2031 年前将收费提高至 15 美元
item.description: 纽约市交通官员将于周一就一项修订后的收费计划进行投票表决，该计划将从 1 月份开始向大多数驾车者收取 9 美元，到 2031 年将增至 15 美元。【原文：New York City transit officials are set to vote Monday on a revised toll program that would charge most motorists $9 to drive into large sections of Manhattan starting in January, with the fee set to increase to $15 by 2031.】

item.title: 美联储疑虑升温，亚洲股市开局疲软：市场综述
item.description: 周一早盘，大多数亚洲股市都将下跌，因为交易员们抑制了对美联储宽松政策的预期，并接受了当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提出的财政和贸易政策的代价。【原文：Most Asian stocks are set to fall early Monday as traders rein in expectations of Federal Reserve easing and come to terms with the cost of President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed fiscal and trade policies.】

item.title: Halozyme 首席执行官表示将为拟议的 Evotec 收购案提供现金资助
item.description: Halozyme Therapeutics Inc.首席执行官海伦-托利（Helen Torley）表示，该公司计划以现金出资20亿欧元（21亿美元）收购德国Evotec SE公司。【原文：Halozyme Therapeutics Inc. plans to finance its €2 billion ($2.1 billion) proposed takeover of Germany’s Evotec SE in cash, according to Chief Executive Officer Helen Torley.】

item.title: 斯塔尔默将会见习近平，用推动增长为英中解冻辩护
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，他将于周一会见中国国家主席习近平，这是旨在推动英国经济增长的解冻关系尝试的一部分，这使他与当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的鹰派立场相左。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he’ll meet China’s President Xi Jinping on Monday, part of an attempted thaw in relations aimed at driving economic growth in Britain that puts him at odds with the hawkish stance of President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 亚洲首富加入普及仿人机器人的竞赛
item.description: 一家由亚洲首富控制的印度初创公司正在进军类人机器人市场，与在这一新兴领域占得先机的美国和中国竞争对手一较高下。【原文：An Indian startup controlled by Asia’s richest man is entering the market for human-like robots, taking on US and Chinese rivals who have a head start in the burgeoning field.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得美国大选后，以黄金为支撑的交易所交易基金的持仓量受到打击。全球对更多鸡肉的需求提振了家禽生产商。随着联合国 COP29 气候峰会进入第二周，欧洲的数据显示我们正在失去限制全球变暖的斗争。【原文：Holdings in exchange-traded funds backed by gold are taking a beating following Donald Trump’s US election win. The global appetite for more chicken is giving poultry producers a lift. And as the United Nations’ COP29 climate summit enters its second week, European data shows we’re losing the fight to limit global warming.】

item.title: 米莱伊在卢拉的 20 国集团会议上愉快地扮演着搅局者的角色
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱在抵达里约热内卢参加巴西 20 国集团峰会之前，就已经开始为路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统的盛大聚会制造麻烦。【原文：Even before he landed in Rio de Janeiro for Brazil’s Group of 20 summit, Argentina’s Javier Milei had already started raining on President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s big party.】
